meanings.definition: To inspire or encourage someone to work harder or achieve a goal again.
meanings.sent1: After the pep talk, the coach was able to remotivate the team for the final game.
meanings.sent2: The success story of the entrepreneur remotivated me to pursue my dreams.
meanings.sent3: The motivational speaker joked that he could remotivate a sloth to run a marathon.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected win remotivated the underdog team to aim for the championship.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finish line remotivated the exhausted runner to push through the pain.

meanings.definition: To provide new motivation or enthusiasm for a task or goal.

meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party as a reward was enough to remotivate the office staff.
